---
  description: Creates a two colour binned gradient (low-high), creates a diverging binned colour gradient (low-mid-high), and creates a n-colour binned gradient and then convert them with ggplotly.
  function: scale_steps
  permalink: /ggplot2/Scales/scale_steps/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: scale_steps
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---



# Default plot


<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = runif(100),
  y = runif(100),
  z1 = rnorm(100)
)
p <-    
 ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point(aes(colour = z1)) +
  scale_colour_steps()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Divergent binned scale

<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = runif(100),
  y = runif(100),
  z1 = rnorm(100)
)
p <-    
 ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point(aes(colour = z1)) +
  scale_colour_steps2()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Defining custom colour map


<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = runif(100),
  y = runif(100),
  z1 = rnorm(100)
)
p <-    
 ggplot(df, aes(x, y)) +
  geom_point(aes(colour = z1)) +
  scale_colour_stepsn(colours = terrain.colors(10))
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>
